timeline.bodyText: Throwing Exceptions is expensive, because generating the tree of calls can take some time. Please invert the if statement as you are ignoring the thrown Exception anyway.
timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText: why do you ignore all exceptions?
timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
The reason I decided to ignore them is that there's the getLength method which could throw a ParsingException and because the segments are optional data, not like the title or description.
But thinking about it I should've worked with .has()  and return the empty list when it's "obviouly" not present by non-existing JSON-key, otherwise doing the actual parsing with its exceptions throwing if there are errors retrieving the objects etc.
I'd reset the three commits and do it more clearer tomorrow, okay? ;)
replies.author: vkay94

timeline.bodyText: this looks YouTube specific and should therefore be moved from within the function to the function call.
timeline.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
Actually, it can be removed completely. The encoding when it's printed in the console is different to the one when saving the html itself from source tab in Chrome/Firefox (I checked it via System.out.println()) :')
So I'll wrap it with fixThumbnailUrl(url) then like the other getThumbnailUrl calls.
replies.author: vkay94

timeline.message: Stream segments: Remove replaceAll from setPreviewUrl
